name: Hair Bearing Skin
description: Hair bearing (thin) skin covers most of the body. It is characterized by the presence of hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and a thinner epidermis compared to thick skin.

features: Sebaceous Glands: Holocrine glands attached to hair follicles
Arrector Pili muscles: Smooth muscle attached to follicles
theory.examTips: Identify by Hair Follicles and Sebaceous Glands. Stratum Lucidum is ABSENT. Epidermal ridges (rete ridges) are less prominent than in thick skin.

name: Normal Skin
description: The skin (integument) consists of the epidermis (epithelium) and dermis (connective tissue). It rests on the hypodermis (subcutaneous fat).

features: Layers (Deep to Superficial): Basale, Spinosum, Granulosum, (Lucidum), Corneum
Dermis: Papillary (loose CT) and Reticular (dense irregular CT) layers
Cells: Keratinocytes (dominant), Melanocytes, Langerhans cells, Merkel cells
Dermal Papillae interdigitate with Epidermal Rete Ridges
theory.examTips: Thick Skin (Palms/Soles) has NO hair/sebaceous glands, a THICK Stratum Corneum, and a Stratum Lucidum. Thin skin has hair/sebaceous glands and NO Stratum Lucidum. The 'Normal Skin' slide usually refers to Thin Skin unless specified.
